DataElement.preferredName: Fiduciary Marker Placement No Success Reason Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text to describe why a fiduciary marker was not successfully placed in a patient.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Fiduciary Marker Placement No Success Reason
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A medical device placed on or inserted in an anatomic site for accurate visualization of a particular area, prior to radiation treatment or surgery.  Examples include markers inserted in the prostate gland for visualization of the site affected by cancer, prior to radiation therapy; markers taped to the scalp prior to imaging in frameless stereotactic brain surgery; and femoral and tibial pins used for patial orientation in total knee replacement._Position or arrangement, as of the teeth; the state of being placed or arranged, as the assignment of a person to a appropriate clinical study._The non-affirmative response to a question._An event that accomplishes its intended purpose._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A medical device placed on or inserted in an anatomic site for accurate visualization of a particular area, prior to radiation treatment or surgery.  Examples include markers inserted in the prostate gland for visualization of the site affected by cancer, prior to radiation therapy; markers taped to the scalp prior to imaging in frameless stereotactic brain surgery; and femoral and tibial pins used for patial orientation in total knee replacement.

Concepts.definition: A medical device placed on or inserted in an anatomic site for accurate visualization of a particular area, prior to radiation treatment or surgery. Examples include markers inserted in the prostate gland for visualization of the site affected by cancer, prior to radiation therapy; markers taped to the scalp prior to imaging in frameless stereotactic brain surgery; and femoral and tibial pins used for spatial orientation in total knee replacement.

Concepts.definition: Position or arrangement, as of the teeth; the state of being placed or arranged, as the assignment of a person to a appropriate clinical study.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
An event that accomplishes its intended purpose.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.
